page.title: 01The Dymock Area
page.content: Our block covers a country area to the north of the village of Dymock. The River Leadon flows through the block and the M.50 crosses the south western corner. Most of the land is farmed, with dairy farming the main activity. The scenery is very pleasant with views of May Hill, Marcle Hill and the Malvern Hills. There are some orchards and a large wood. Most of the people live in the village of Dymock. The motorway brings lots of tourists, especially in spring to see the wild daffodils. The motorway also makes it possible for people to live in Dymock and work in Birmingham although it is 50 miles away. The nearest small towns are Ledbury and Newent, each about 4 miles away. It is about 15 miles to Gloucester.
